alert.note: Alert for McCreary; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 7:09PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern McCreary and southwestern Whitley Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 709 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bounty, or near Williamsburg. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Williamsburg around 715 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Hollyhill, Bon, Jellico Creek, Ayers, Zion Hill, Emlyn, Pleasant View and Mountain Ash. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
